intro: Psilogramme cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban psilogramme, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the Caribbean region, particularly Cuba, and thrives in moist, tropical environments. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads. It is often found in coastal areas and wetlands, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
